title: Harbor , Aptos volleyball teams win titles at Harbor Tournament | Local Roundup
body_text:
Harbor High’s girls volleyball team picked up two more wins on Saturday to claim the Gold Division title at the two-day Harbor Tournament in Santa Cruz.
The Pirates (19-9 overall) finished 4-0 in their tournament. They beat their two biggest Santa Cruz Coast Athletic League foes to secure the crown.
Harbor beat Scotts Valley 25-11, 17-25, 11-25, 25-19, 15-12 in the final, and Santa Cruz 17-25, 17-25, 29-27, 25-20, 16-14 in the semifinals.
Junior outside hitter Dylan Schutz had 20 digs, 11 kills, and four aces in the final. Junior opposite Cecile Novembre made 19 kills, and junior Setter Gianna Fanara had 41 assists, two aces, and three blocks. Junior libero Swan Houssin made 21 digs.
In the semifinals, Novembre had 25 kills and 19 digs, and Fanara had 38 assists, nine digs, and four kills. Junior middle blocker Maisie McAlister made seven kills, and Houssin made 26 digs.
In the Silver Division action, held at Soquel High, Aptos (15-11) swept the host Knights 25-17, 25-20, 25-23 in the semifinals and Sobrato 25-16, 25-14, 25-19 in the final. Soquel (11-11) topped Mercy of Burlingame for third place.
Harbor plays at Soquel in the annual Dig Pink match on Tuesday at 6:30 p.m.
College football
At Merced 35, Cabrillo 19: The Seahawks suffered their sixth straight loss Saturday and dropped to 0-2 in Coast Conference action.
Seahawks quarterback Mario Cosma completed 21 of 29 passes for 196 yards. He rushed for a pair of touchdowns. Eduardo Garcia-Martinez kicked a pair of field goals, from 24 and 39 yards out.
Jabari Phillips and David Herrera each rushed for a pair of touchdowns for the Blue Devils (4-3, 2-0). Jacquez Jones had a TD reception.
Osaivbie Ekawele made 13 tackles to lead the Seahawks’ defense. Carson Defilippis made 12 stops and Brian Flores had 10, including a sack.
Cabrillo (1-6, 0-2) hosts Gavilan (1-6, 0-2) on Saturday at 6 p.m.
Boys cross country
Rough Rider Invitational: Aptos junior Sam Hansen took second out of 344 runners in the Small Schools race at the Rough Rider Invitational at Woodward Park in Fresno on Friday. Hansen completed the 5,000-meter course in 15:45.22.
Miramonte senior Logan Letulle won in 15:43.79. Ponderosa (70) won the team title.
Mariners senior Brady Bliesner (16:11.15) took 10th, and junior teammate Anthony Sandford-Carroll (16:36.08) took 21st.
Mariner Invitational: Pajaro Valley senior Luis Martinez took 42nd out of 110 runners in the Open race at the 42nd Phil Wilder Mariner Invitational at Quarry Lakes Regional Recreation Area in Fremont on Saturday.
Martinez completed the 5,000-meter course in 17:37.6. Classmate Patrick Lopez (18:47.4) took 71st.
College Park senior Grayson Langford won in 15:59.1 to lead the Falcons (81) to the team title.
Girls cross country
Rough Rider Invitational: Aptos senior Maya Schiro took third out of 261 runners in the Small Schools race at the Rough Rider Invitational at Woodward Park in Fresno on Friday. Schiro completed the 5,000-meter course in 18:17.07.
Carondelet senior Gretchen Yakaitis won in 17:47.32. Miramonte (98) won the team title.
Aptos (158) took fourth out of 32 teams. Mariners junior Kenzie Culbertson (20:13.85) took 23rd, freshman teammate Pierce Culbertson (20:30.01) took 32nd, and junior Mata Overby (20:54.61) was 42nd.
Men’s water polo
Cuesta Tournament: Cabrillo went 2-2 at the two-day Cuesta Tournament over the weekend.
The Seahawks earned wins over Citrus, 21-11, and Chaffey, 12-9, and suffered losses to Cuesta, 25-8, and Saddleback, 19-11.
On the tournament, Bryan Bunker scored 19 goals to lead the Seahawks. Brady Reed and Sam Hoffman each scored eight goals. Aeden Wright chipped in with five goals, and Charlie Lambert added four goals.
“We came out and competed with some of the top teams in the state,” Seahawks coach Jasper Billings said. “We played fantastic overall and improved tremendously this weekend.”
Freshman goalie Tim Allen made 27 saves over four matches.
Cabrillo (10-10) plays at Merced on Wednesday at noon.
Women’s cross country
Bronco Invitational: Seattle senior Azalea Groleau, a San Lorenzo Valley alumna, took sixth out of 151 runners in the Invitational race at the Bronco Invitational at Baylands Regional Park on Saturday. Groleau completed the 6K course in 20:53.1.
Santa Clara junior Milaina Almonte won in 20:06.5.
UC Santa Cruz senior Emma Wirz took 18th out of 117 runners in the the Open Division race. She finished in 23:14.0.
UC Santa Barbara sophomore Ryann Strawn took first in 21:51.1.
UCSC freshman Holly Alchin (23:31.3) took 24th, and junior teammate Madelyn Basinet (23:32.8) took 26th.
Men’s cross country
Bronco Invitational: Cal Poly Distance Club’s Aiden Boothby, a Scotts Valley alum, took eighth out of 200 runners in the Open Division race at the Bronco Invitational at Baylands Regional Park on Saturday. Boothby completed the 8K course in 25:05.6.
Gabriel Planty of ASICS Club took first in 24:24.0.
UCSC junior Liam Manley took 19th in 25:39.2. Banana Slugs freshman Sean Conley (25:54.0; 26th) and sophomore teammate Gavin Hahn (25:55.3; 27th) narrowly missed top-25 finishes.
Women’s volleyball
UCSC finishes 0-4 on trip: UC Santa Cruz dropped two more matches to finish 0-4 in its road trip to Virginia.
The Banana Slugs suffered their fourth straight loss by sweep, falling 25-12, 25-19, 25-13 to Salisbury and 25-19, 25-18, 25-17 to Mary Washington on Saturday.
Kate Lau had eight kills against Salisbury, and Alessandra Ponzo had 12 assists. Lau had seven kills and nine digs against Mary Washington, and Margo Melgoza had 12 assists.
UCSC (8-13) plays Howard Payne (9-9) and Austin (12-7) in Marshall, Texas, on Oct. 31.
Reporting Scores
Coaches are encouraged to report scores and highlights to sports@santacruzsentinel.com following games. Please include your name and contact number in the email.
